title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http:contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

Device used facilitate navigation foggy conditions warning potential hazards ahead. foghorn makes accessible R terminal CRAN check results packages maintained individuals, packages interest. results presented colored summary, tibble. function generates summary designed called .Rprofile can check status packages regularly. new features introduced development versions R, new policies put place, packages updated frequently may start generating warnings errors checked CRAN’s infrastructure. foghorn brings information terminal don’t leave comfort R session know results CRAN checks packages.

title: Summarize CRAN Check Results in the Terminal
text: can install development version foghorn github : stable version CRAN:

title: Summarize CRAN Check Results in the Terminal
text: foghorn provides results package CRAN checks. maintainer, can easily get results checks packages using email address included DESCRIPTION file packages. summary_cran_results() provides graphical summary results CRAN checks. number parenthesis name package indicates number platforms used CRAN produced result. summary_cran_results() actually alias summary(cran_results()), meaning can call cran_results() directly want easily access underlying data results CRAN checks. results stored tibble. addition packages, can also check results packages might interest : can inspect logs check results using summary_cran_details(pkg) (summary(cran_details(pkg))), visit_cran_check(pkg) takes directly CRAN webpage.
code: ## load the package library(foghorn) ## Graphical interface summary_cran_results(email = "francois.michonneau@gmail.com") #> ✔ All clear for foghorn, riceware, rotl! #> ★  Packages with notes on CRAN:  #>   - phylobase (1) #>   - rncl (3) ## Results of the checks as a tibble cran_results(email = "francois.michonneau@gmail.com") #> # A tibble: 5 x 7 #>   package   error  fail  warn  note    ok has_other_issues #>   <chr>     <int> <int> <int> <int> <int> <lgl>            #> 1 foghorn       0     0     0     0    12 FALSE            #> 2 phylobase     0     0     0     1    11 FALSE            #> 3 riceware      0     0     0     0    12 FALSE            #> 4 rncl          0     0     0     3     9 FALSE            #> 5 rotl          0     0     0     0    12 FALSE ## either by themselves summary_cran_results(pkg = c("ggplot2", "dplyr")) #> ★  Packages with notes on CRAN:  #>   - dplyr (5) #>   - ggplot2 (5)  cran_results(pkg = c("ggplot2", "dplyr")) #> # A tibble: 2 x 7 #>   package error  fail  warn  note    ok has_other_issues #>   <chr>   <int> <int> <int> <int> <int> <lgl>            #> 1 dplyr       0     0     0     5     7 FALSE            #> 2 ggplot2     0     0     0     5     7 FALSE  ## or by combining them with email addresses summary_cran_results(   email = "francois.michonneau@gmail.com",   pkg = c("mregions", "ridigbio") ) #> ✔ All clear for foghorn, mregions, riceware, ridigbio, rotl! #> ★  Packages with notes on CRAN:  #>   - phylobase (1) #>   - rncl (3)  cran_results(   email = "francois.michonneau@gmail.com",   pkg = c("mregions", "ridigbio") ) #> # A tibble: 7 x 7 #>   package   error  fail  warn  note    ok has_other_issues #>   <chr>     <int> <int> <int> <int> <int> <lgl>            #> 1 foghorn       0     0     0     0    12 FALSE            #> 2 mregions      0     0     0     0    12 FALSE            #> 3 phylobase     0     0     0     1    11 FALSE            #> 4 riceware      0     0     0     0    12 FALSE            #> 5 ridigbio      0     0     0     0    12 FALSE            #> 6 rncl          0     0     0     3     9 FALSE            #> 7 rotl          0     0     0     0    12 FALSE (tidyr_checks <- cran_details(pkg = "tidyr")) #> # A tibble: 1 x 7 #>   package version result check      flavors              n_flavors message       #>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>  <chr>      <chr>                    <dbl> <chr>         #> 1 tidyr   1.1.2   NOTE   data for … r-devel-linux-x86_6…         5 "     Note: … summary(tidyr_checks) #> ★ tidyr - note: data for non-ASCII characters #>    ❯ r-devel-linux-x86_64-fedora-clang  #>    ❯ r-devel-linux-x86_64-fedora-gcc  #>    ❯ r-patched-solaris-x86  #>    ❯ r-release-macos-x86_64  #>    ❯ r-oldrel-macos-x86_64  #>  #>      Note: found 24 marked UTF-8 strings

However, statistics large number packages, using CRAN database recommended (’s 20Mb data). use CRAN database, add src = "crandb" function calls: Check “Details” section help files information.

what: Get details about the CRAN check results for packages — cran_details
title: Get details about the CRAN check results for packages — cran_details
text: Given names packages published CRAN, return output checks return notes, warnings errors.

title: Get details about the CRAN check results for packages — cran_details
code: cran_details(pkg, src = c("website", "crandb"), ...)  # S3 method for cran_details summary(object, show_log = TRUE, print_ok = TRUE, ...)  summary_cran_details(   pkg,   src = c("website", "crandb"),   show_log = TRUE,   print_ok = TRUE,   ... )

title: Get details about the CRAN check results for packages — cran_details
text: pkg character vector names packages CRAN src "website" data scrapped CRAN website, "crandb" data downloaded RDS file hosted CRAN servers (used generate information found CRAN website). ... additional arguments control data check results coming downloaded CRAN servers (see Details section). object object created cran_details show_log messages “Check Details” printed? (logical) print_ok TRUE summary method print "clear" message package(s) OK status CRAN checks.

title: Get details about the CRAN check results for packages — cran_details
text: tibble listing names packages non- OK check results, nature result (WARN, ERROR, FAIL, NOTE, issues).

title: Get details about the CRAN check results for packages — cran_details
text: data come ? data comes CRAN servers. generate RDS files contains information regarding results checks packages, flavors. data used generate web pages. foghorn provides access either data sources. choose src = "website" data scrapped CRAN website. need check packages, good option. choose src = "crandb" RDS files (20Mb) downloaded first CRAN servers. choosing src = "crandb" can also specify following options: dest  folder store RDS files (tempdir() default). protocol  either https (default) http. overwrite  FALSE (default), file exists dest downloaded . TRUE file gets downloaded every time needed.

what: List packages in CRAN incoming queue. — cran_incoming
title: List packages in CRAN incoming queue. — cran_incoming
text: Check package stands CRAN incoming queue.

title: List packages in CRAN incoming queue. — cran_incoming
code: cran_incoming(   pkg = NULL,   folders = cran_incoming_folders(),   sort_by_date = TRUE )  cran_incoming_folders(include_archive = FALSE)

title: List packages in CRAN incoming queue. — cran_incoming
text: pkg Optionally provide vector package names limit results packages. folders folders CRAN queue want inspect? Default: non-human folders. sort_by_date TRUE (default), output sorted decreasing order according submission time. include_archive TRUE, function cran_incoming_folders() also returns archive folder.

title: List packages in CRAN incoming queue. — cran_incoming
text: cran_incoming() returns tibble following columns: package package name version package version cran_folder folder package found time date/time package entered folder size size package tarball cran_incoming_folders() returns character vector names folders used part CRAN submission process, archive included optionally. Note package version provided, appear NA tibble.

title: List packages in CRAN incoming queue. — cran_incoming
text: submitting package CRAN, undergoes series checks published publicly available. cran_incoming() allows check packages currently queue, folder located. information help track package submission. following folders considered (approximately order CRAN queue sequence): newbies, inspect, pretest, recheck, pending, waiting, publish. folder archive inspected default. folders named initials CRAN volunteers inspected.

title: List packages in CRAN incoming queue. — cran_incoming
text: meaning package folders follows (see Hornik, Ligges Zeileis https://journal.r-project.org/archive/2018-1/cran.pdf Uwe Ligges mailing list comment https://stat.ethz.ch/pipermail/r-package-devel/2019q1/003631.html): newbies first time submission; package manually inspected. inspect package awaiting manual inspection; always happens first time submissions packages problems likely false positives pretest human triggered new auto-check package recheck package passed checks waiting reverse dependency checking pending CRAN team member closer inspection needs time waiting CRAN's decision waiting response package maintainer, e.g. issues present CRAN check incoming checks publish package awaiting publication archive package rejected: pass checks cleanly problems unlikely false positives

title: List packages in CRAN incoming queue. — cran_incoming
text: information provided give indication package stands submission process. can useful confirm package correctly uploaded CRAN. Please consult CRAN Repository Policy questions.

title: List packages in CRAN incoming queue. — cran_incoming
text: Hornik, Ligges Zeileis. "Changes CRAN: 2017-12-01 2018-06-30", R Journal 10(1), July 2018. https://journal.r-project.org/archive/2018-1/cran.pdf Maëlle Salmon, Locke Data, Stephanie Locke, Mitchell O'Hara-Wild, Hugo Gruson. "CRAN incoming dashboard", https://lockedata.github.io/cransays/articles/dashboard.html

TRUE file gets downloaded every time needed.

what: CRAN check results at the terminal — foghorn
title: CRAN check results at the terminal — foghorn
text: foghorn brings results CRAN checks R terminal. package intended developers published packages CRAN. results checks can summarized tibble (see cran_results), “pretty” terminal output (see summary_cran_results).  package also provides functions view logs CRAN check results (see cran_details), visit web pages hosted CRAN (see visit_cran_check).

what: The number of CRAN flavors — n_cran_flavors
title: The number of CRAN flavors — n_cran_flavors
text: CRAN flavors, systems CRAN tests packages regularly, listed https://cran.r-project.org/web/checks/check_flavors.html. get correct results, foghorn needs know many flavors CRAN uses. function reads number flavors CRAN currently uses, caches (per session, tempdir() folder). Arguments control caching, fall back, default values.

title: The number of CRAN flavors — n_cran_flavors
code: n_cran_flavors(   use_cache = getOption("foghorn.use_cache", TRUE),   force_default = getOption("foghorn.force_default", FALSE),   n_flavors = getOption("foghorn.n_flavors", 14L) )

title: The number of CRAN flavors — n_cran_flavors
text: use_cache value number flavors read / written cache? (default: TRUE) force_default default value used? (default: FALSE). TRUE, number flavors read Internet. n_flavors default number flavors? (default: 14L)

title: The number of CRAN flavors — n_cran_flavors
text: number CRAN check flavors (integer).

title: The number of CRAN flavors — n_cran_flavors
text: default values arguments read options. Given n_cran_flavors function relied internally provide accurate information user, using options allows control function behaves directly. general, default values changed. provided case issues connecting web page listing number flavors, want use caching. options can set: session, using, instance,options("foghorn.use_cache" = FALSE). permanently, adding options("foghorn.use_cache" = FALSE) .Rprofile. specific call, using withr package: withr::with_options(foghorn.use_cache = FALSE,  ...).

text: tibble following columns: package package name version package version folder folder indicating R version used perform checks time date time package tarball uploaded win-builder size size package tarball

text: check whether package successfully submitted win-builder, check whether unusual delay processing packages submitted win-builder, winbuilder_queue allows inspect packages queue processed win-builder service.

title: Show the win-builder queue — winbuilder_queue
text: Maëlle Salmon, 2020. "Everything know WinBuilder" https://blog.r-hub.io/2020/04/01/win-builder/ Uwe Ligges. Building checking R source packages Windows. https://win-builder.r-project.org/

title: Show the win-builder queue — winbuilder_queue
code: if (FALSE) {   ## Get all the packages in the win-builder queue   winbuilder_queue()   ## Check if the 'dplyr' package is in the win-builder queue   winbuilder_queue(pkg = "dplyr")   ## Check which packages are in the R-devel queue   winbuilder_queue(folders = "R-devel") }
